meanings.definition: To move or act quickly and energetically.
meanings.sent1: She brisked through the park to catch the bus.
meanings.sent2: The squirrel brisked across the tree branches.
meanings.sent3: The little dog brisked around the yard, chasing its tail.
meanings.sent4: Time brisked by like a speeding train.
meanings.sent5: The wind brisked through the open window, carrying the scent of flowers.

meanings.definition: To make something more lively or active.
meanings.sent1: He brisked up the party with his funny jokes.
meanings.sent2: The music brisked up the atmosphere in the room.
meanings.sent3: Adding sprinkles brisked up the plain cupcake.
meanings.sent4: Her smile brisked up the gloomy mood in the office.
meanings.sent5: A touch of color brisked up the dull painting.
